findings.title: Unprotected constructor
findings.description: The constructor of a contract is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially causing unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected withdrawDividend function
findings.description: The withdrawDividend function is unprotected and can be exploited by unauthorized users.

findings.title: Unprotected distributeDividends function
findings.description: The distributeDividends function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected setBalance function
findings.description: The setBalance function is unprotected and can be exploited by unauthorized users.

findings.title: Unprotected processAccount function
findings.description: The processAccount function lacks protection, potentially leading to unauthorized access or manipulation.

findings.title: Unprotected excludeFromDividends function
findings.description: The excludeFromDividends function is declared as external and lacks access modifiers, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected updateClaimWait function
findings.description: The updateClaimWait function is declared as External and only accessible by the owner, but it lacks proper protection.

findings.title: Centralization Risk
findings.description: Active contract ownership identified, which can lead to centralization of power and increase the risk of rug pull scams.
